meanings.definition: Consisting of or resembling a thin layer or plate
meanings.sent1: The laminous paper was so thin it tore easily.
meanings.sent2: She admired the laminous wings of the delicate butterfly.
meanings.sent3: The laminous cake layers made it look like a tower of sweetness.
meanings.sent4: The laminous clouds in the sky seemed to float effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The artist used a laminous paint to create a shimmering effect on the canvas.

meanings.definition: Capable of being split into thin layers
meanings.sent1: The laminous rock could be easily separated into thin pieces.
meanings.sent2: The chef used laminous sheets of dough for the pastry.
meanings.sent3: He joked that the laminous cheese was perfect for sharing with friends.
meanings.sent4: The laminous ice cracked into beautiful shards under his feet.
meanings.sent5: The laminous fabric could be torn into strips for crafting.

meanings.sent1: The laminous cake had alternating layers of chocolate and vanilla.
meanings.sent2: The forest had a laminous canopy with leaves at different heights.
meanings.sent3: The laminous bookshelf made it easy to organize his books.
meanings.sent4: Her laminous hair fell in cascading layers down her back.
meanings.sent5: The laminous building had floors stacked like a tower.
